item.title: April add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: April add a quote by John Green
item.description: "So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was a hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: April add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "People go on marrying because they can't resist natural forces, although many of them may know perfectly well that they are possibly buying a month's pleasure with a life's discomfort." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: April add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: April add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Love is a possible strength in an actual weakness." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: April add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Do you know that I have undergone three quarters of this labour entirely for the sake of the fourth quarter?" -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: April add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
April add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: April add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: April add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "For how can one know color in perpetual green, and what good is warmth without cold to give it sweetness?" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: April add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "And at home by the fire, whenever you look up there I shall be— and whenever I look up, there will be you. -Gabriel Oak" -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I ask you to pass through life at my side—to be my second self, and best earthly companion." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: April add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Do you like him much?' I told you I liked him a little. Where is the use of caring for him so very much: he is full of faults.' Is he?' All boys are." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: April add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: April add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "When I think of what life is, and how seldom love is answered by love; it is one of the moments for which the world was made." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: April add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "This desire to govern a woman -- it lies very deep, and men and women must fight it together.... But I do love you surely in a better way then he does." He thought. "Yes -- really in a better way. I want you to have your own thoughts even when I hold you in my arms." -- E.M. Forster
